definition: variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring

sentences.english: They selected a diamond engagement ring.
sentences.chinese: 他們遴選了一枚鑽石訂親戒指。

sentences.english: Jane's being engaged to Black made her parents very angry…
sentences.chinese: 簡將與布萊克訂親，這使她地怙恃很生氣。

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: needlework/sewing
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
to whisper to one another's ear
lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
a short time/a little while
marriage by capture/bride kidnapping
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to forget previous differences/to bury the hatchet
female gossip/busybody
protective coloration/camouflage
